intro: Benthamantha glabella, commonly known as the smooth benthamantha, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its rarity and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for botanical research and conservation efforts.
